title: Standard Method
description: The schema outlines the required metadata to define a standard method or protocol

alternative_labels.title: Alternative codes, labels or names
alternative_labels.description: Any alternative codes, labels or names for the method (not forthe technique or tools!). This could be an acronym or a full text name if an acronym is used as the preferred label. This is useful for search and discovery purposes.

method_type.title: Method Type
method_type.description: The type of method this represents. Examples are 'Analysis Method', 'Research support'... This is a free text field but will be converted into a controlled vocabulary field.

technique.title: Relevant Technique
technique.description: The general technique that this Method is an application of.

method_version.title: Version
method_version.description: The version identifier for this method

creation_date.title: Creation Date
creation_date.description: The date this method was created

author.title: Author
author.description: A relevant person ID, either a local database ID or an ORCID, for the creator or author of this method

related_tools.title: Related Tools
related_tools.description: The key related tools (equipment or software) described associated with this method. FIXLAB, MOLAB and DIGILAB methods should define at least one tool; for ARCHLAB methods this is optional.

tool_role_other.title: Other Tool Role
tool_role_other.description: If the tool role is not in the controlled vocabulary, please specify it here.

method_documentation.title: Method Documentation
method_documentation.description: The documentation for the method, this can be a reference to an external document or a textual description

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: The formatted details for the given reference.

method_parameter.title: Core Method Parameters
method_parameter.description: A list of the core or key equipment or software parameters used within this method. This does not need to be an exhaustive list and can be limited to the parameters which are used to control the activity, might influence subsequent interpretations or will be important for data comparison and discovery.

parameter_value.title: Value
parameter_value.description: The value of the core method value.

parameter_unit.title: Unit
parameter_unit.description: The unit it which the value is expressed.  This dropdown list gives a few examples, but if required, you can define your own component type here.

parameter_related_tool.title: Parameter Specific Related Tool
parameter_related_tool.description: When multiple Tools are used within a single method, defined parameters can be associated to the relevant tool. This can be left blank for single tool Methods and the assumption will be that the parameters are associated with single tool related to the Method in general.
